required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Diabetes Mellitus and Pregnancy : Knowledge Assessment
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Knowledge About Contraception and Pregnancy Planning Among Type 1 and Type 2 Diabetes Women

brief_summary.textblock:
Diabetes, a chronic and frequent disease, is a risk factor of pregnancy complications such as preeclampsia, congenital malformations and macrosomia.
Preconception care is all methods to assess the best prognostic for a diabetic pregnancy. Among these methods, contraception is very important to plan the pregnancy on a chosen moment.
The content of the preconception care is well established. However, information of diabetic women concerning contraception and giabetic pregnancy has been little studied.

detailed_description.textblock: The aim of the study is to describe the knowledge of the patients with diabetes concerning contraception and pregnancy planning.

primary_outcome.description: Knowledge concerning the risk of unplanned pregnancy in diabete women

arm_group.description: Women between 18 and 40 years old with type 1 and type 2 diabetes

study_pop.textblock: Women between 18 and 40 years old, consulting in diabetology department of Reims Universitary Hospital and Charleville Mézières General Hospital

criteria.textblock:
inclusion criteria :
- Patients Aged between 18 and 40 years old
- With type 1 or type 2 diabetes mellitus
- Consulting in the department of diabetology in Reims and Charleville Mezieres hospitals
- Accepting to participate in the study
exclusion criteria :
- Patients With secondary diabetes (endocrine, pancreatic or genetical origin)
- With postmenopausal status
- Without capacity to have a pregnancy (uterine aplasia, hysterectomy)
